instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01949: What is 820-01949? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL9240: What is ISL9240? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2018 through 2020.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damaged
threads.message: Hi guys, I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that came in with wine damage. Customer said the webcam stopped working. Keyboard was also completely sticky as well as power button, also some wine spilled around T2 chip area. Mac was still turned on. Explained to the customer we had to clean it, and there is a chance it might stop working during this attempt, which now, of course, it did. Board looks super clean after ultrasonic. Even before that, no corrosion only some sticky wine. All area look good. What I get now is 20v an 0.0 - 0.07 amp. T2 gets slightly warm. Tried DFU mode but I think this only works when stuck at 5v? Also not sure the keyboard and power button work, have no other housing to test :(. PPBUS switches between 12.64 and 12.32v. Tried also with battery connected and of course original charger, both 60 and 85 wats:unsure:.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damaged
threads.message:
If <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> drops to 12.3V means communication between T2 and <CHIP>ISL9240</CHIP> is lost.
AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages are stable?
Also check G3S voltages.
